New Records: The Cubs have racked up 98 hits, 80 runs, 43 extra-base hits, 18 stolen bases and 14 home runs over their last eight games, according to OptaSTATS, with no other team in MLB history having reached all these numbers in an eight-game span.
Pre-Game Insights: The Cubs have won 10 of their last 13 games, moving three games over.500 and rising to second place in the NL Central, 10 games back of the Milwaukee Brewers.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The 80 runs are the club's most in an eight-game stretch since 1935, when Chicago crossed home plate 84 times from Sept. 11 to Sept. 18. The only other seasons where the Cubs had at least 80 runs during an eight-game period came in 1929 and 1930, when MLB's run-scoring levels were historically high.
